alert.note: Alert for Rowan (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 27 at 1:47AM EST until December 28 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 AM EST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by runoff from recent excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of Rowan County in Piedmont North Carolina. * WHEN...Until 445 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding of low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 142 AM EST, Stream gauges reported minor flooding along North Second Creek near Woodleaf due to the recent heavy rainfall. Additional light showers may affect the area through the early morning hours to keep stream levels elevated. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Piedmont Research Station. - Flooding is most likely to affect the vicinity of North Second Creek south of Woodleaf. Low water crossings may be affected on White Road, Lyerly Road, Upright Road, Graham Road, Childers Road, and Bear Poplar Road. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
